column1: # Circuit/class names are assigned to every field name on the base of the original source of the data
# i.e data related to the heatpump but read from the energy manager ebus address are assigned to "heatpump"
# For a single parameter there could be multiple lines in this file:

column2: ... --> line to issue direct read commands (eg using ebuscl read)
... --> line to issue direct write commands (eg using ebuscl write)
... --> line to process broadcasted messages that convey the specific parameter value
... --> line to process messages that are not broadcasted but are grabbed to get some parameter value (ie. message from one device to another)

column1: # ANY HELP ON DECODING OTHER MESSAGES IS WELCOME
column2: ATM THE MISSING BITS OF INFORMATION ARE MAINLY

column1: # System Bus Scan and ID request  (eg. 00fe203a0123) - do not parse the messages as it doesn't contain meaningful info
# It seems that one device "special" address (00) scan the bus with a 203a command followed by every available bus address
# then these devices reply with a 203b message stating their owm addresses
# System Bus ID Replies (eg. 03fe203b011e) - do not parse the messages until is found a way to forward both request and reply
# These are part of the dicovery process/initial handshake following a bus scan command
column2: it seems that every device reply

column1: # to the bus scan request with a message broadcasting his own slave address 03=sender
# some "special" device don't respect the rule of slave address=master address+5 (eg. 00/02
# System Bus Control (??) (eg. 7ffe20380503c8030708) - probably related to devices bus role identification

column3: the first data hex byte seems to be related to the function of the device
